io.multimap

Class Options

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.multimap.Options

  • public class Options
extends Object
    This class is a pure data holder used for configuration purposes.
    Author:
    Martin Trenkmann

    • Method Detail

      • getBlockSize

        public int getBlockSize()
        Returns the block size in number of bytes.
        See Also:
        setBlockSize(int)

      • setBlockSize

        public void setBlockSize(int blockSize)
        Defines the block size in number of bytes for a newly created map. The value must be a power of two. Typical block sizes are 128, 256, 512 (default), 1024, or even larger. Please refer to the overview section on the project's website for more details.

      • keepBlockSize

        public void keepBlockSize()
        Sets the block size to a special value that indicates to the optimize operation that the block size should not be changed.
        See Also:
        Map.optimize(java.nio.file.Path, java.nio.file.Path, Options)

      • getNumPartitions

        public int getNumPartitions()
        Returns the number of partitions.
        See Also:
        setNumPartitions(int)

      • setNumPartitions

        public void setNumPartitions(int numPartitions)
        Defines the number of partitions for a newly created map. The purpose of partitioning is to increase the performance of the export and optimize operations by applying a divide and conquer method. A suitable number can be estimated like this: "total number of value-bytes to be put" divided by "the memory allowed to be used running the operation". An underestimate can lead to long runtimes for the mentioned operations. The default value is 23; other values will be rounded to the next prime number that is greater or equal to the given value.
        See Also:
        Map.exportToBase64(java.nio.file.Path, java.nio.file.Path), Map.exportToBase64(java.nio.file.Path, java.nio.file.Path, Options), Map.optimize(java.nio.file.Path, java.nio.file.Path), Map.optimize(java.nio.file.Path, java.nio.file.Path, Options)

      • keepNumPartitions

        public void keepNumPartitions()
        Sets the number of partitions to a special value that indicates to the optimize operation that the number of partitions should not be changed.
        See Also:
        Map.optimize(java.nio.file.Path, java.nio.file.Path, Options)

      • isCreateIfMissing

        public boolean isCreateIfMissing()
        Returns true if a map should be created if it does not already exist, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setCreateIfMissing(boolean)

      • setCreateIfMissing

        public void setCreateIfMissing(boolean createIfMissing)
        If set to true, creates a new map if it does not exist. The default value is false.

      • isErrorIfExists

        public boolean isErrorIfExists()
        Returns true if an error should be raised in case a map already exists, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setErrorIfExists(boolean)

      • setErrorIfExists

        public void setErrorIfExists(boolean errorIfExists)
        If set to true, throws an exception if a map already exists. The default value is false.

      • isReadonly

        public boolean isReadonly()
        Returns true if a map should be opened in read-only mode, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setReadonly(boolean)

      • setReadonly

        public void setReadonly(boolean readonly)
        If set to true, opens a map in read-only mode. In this mode all operations that could possibly modify the stored data are not allowed and will throw an exception on an attempt to do so. This flag is useful to prevent unintentional updates of read-only datasets. The default value is false.

      • isQuiet

        public boolean isQuiet()
        Returns true if no status information for long running operations are sent to stdout, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setQuiet(boolean)

      • setQuiet

        public void setQuiet(boolean quiet)
        If set to true, no status information for long running operations are sent to stdout. This flag is useful for writing shell scripts. The default value is false.

      • getLessThanCallable

        public Callables.LessThan getLessThanCallable()
        Returns the callable used for comparing values. May be null if no sorting is desired.
        See Also:
        setLessThanCallable(Callables.LessThan)

      • setLessThanCallable

        public void setLessThanCallable(Callables.LessThan lessThan)
        Sets a callable that implements the Callables.LessThan interface. It is used to sort lists of values when running certain operations such as export or optimize. Can be set to null, which is also the default, if no sorting is desired.
        See Also:
        Map.exportToBase64(java.nio.file.Path, java.nio.file.Path, Options), Map.optimize(java.nio.file.Path, java.nio.file.Path, Options)
